intro: Baccharoides rangacharii, commonly known as the Rangacharii baccharis, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
